citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey, Lower Mississippi and Gulf Water Science Center
citeinfo.title: Ground-surface characterization data for 150 point locations within limestone cedar glades at Stones River National Battlefield near Murfreesboro, Tennessee
citeinfo.othercit: Recommended citation: J. Cartwright. 2015, Ground-surface characterization data for 150 point locations within limestone cedar glades at Stones River National Battlefield near Murfreesboro, Tennessee: U.S. Geological Survey Data Release, http://dx.doi.org/10.5066/F7NV9G9C

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey, Lower Mississippi and Gulf Water Science Center
citeinfo.title: 2015 Hydrologic and soil data collected in limestone cedar glades at Stones River National Battlefield, Tennessee (USGS Data Release)

descript.abstract: This dataset contains data collected within limestone cedar glades at Stones River National Battlefield (STRI) near Murfreesboro, Tennessee. This dataset represents data collected at 150 quadrat locations (points) within 12 selected cedar glades and contains quantitative characterizations of the ground surface, measurements of depth to bedrock (soil depth), and calculations of canopy coverage based on digital photography. When combined with the hydrologic and soil chemical and microbiological datasets described in the summary section, this information can be used to evaluate relationships between abiotic stressors (such as extreme hydrologic conditions, extreme temperatures, or thin soils) and soil microbial indicators. This information can also be used to explore the factors governing hydrologic conditions within these cedar glades. Missing values are indicated by the value -99999.Detailed descriptions of experimental design, field data collection procedures, laboratory procedures, and data analysis are presented in Cartwright (2014).References:Cartwright, J. (2014). Soil ecology of a rock outcrop ecosystem: abiotic stresses, soil respiration, and microbial community profiles in limestone cedar glades. Ph.D. dissertation, Tennessee State University.Cofer, M., Walck, J., and Hidayati, S. (2008). Species richness and exotic species invasion in Middle Tennessee cedar glades in relation to abiotic and biotic factors. The Journal of the Torrey Botanical Society, 135(4), 540–553.
descript.purpose: This dataset was developed by the U.S. Geological Survey Tennessee Water Science Center (TNWSC) in partnership with the National Park Service staff at Stones River National Battlefield (STRI) for the purpose of characterizing a subset of limestone cedar glades present within STRI. This dataset contains data types which were only measured once over the course of a study which lasted from September of 2011 through December of 2013. It is intended to be used in conjunction with other spatial datasets generated by the same project, namely datasets representing monthly hydrologic observations (STRI_Glades_Soil_Water_Content_OD.shp, STRI_Glades_Soil_Water_Content_TDR.shp, and STRI_Glades_Soil_Water_Content_ALL.shp) and monthly analysis of soil samples collected (STRI_Glades_Soil_pH.shp, STRI_Glades_Soil_Nitrate.shp, STRI_Glades_Soil_Organic_Matter.shp, STRI_Glades_Soil_Respiration.shp). The attribute “Point_Code” should be used to join data from this file to data in monthly hydrologic and soil files.

timeperd.current: Data in this dataset was obtained through field measurement and observation conducted from September 28 to November 2, 2011.

place.placekey: Stones River National Battlefield, STRI, Limestone Cedar Glades, Murfreesboro

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

procstep.procdesc:
An unpublished polygon shapefile of 40 limestone glades within Stones River National Battlefield was acquired (National Park Service, undated). Following preliminary field visits to determine accessibility, 12 of the 40 glades were chosen for study (for details on glade selection methodology see Cartwright, 2014). The ArcGIS Buffer tool (Esri, 2010) was used to create a 3-meter buffer around each glade polygon. The ArcGIS Create Random Points tool (Esri, 2010) was used to create a point feature class of 150 random sampling locations within and near the 12 glades; 80% of the points were generated within the glade interiors, and 20% of the points were generated within their 3-meter buffers. Detailed descriptions of experimental design, field data collection procedures, laboratory procedures, and data analysis are presented in Cartwright (2014). For details about tabular attributes included in this data set, see the entity and attributes section of this metadata document.
References
Cartwright, J. (2014). Soil ecology of a rock outcrop ecosystem: abiotic stresses, soil respiration, and microbial community profiles in limestone cedar glades. Ph.D. dissertation, Tennessee State University.
Esri, 2010, ArcGIS: Release 10. Redlands, CA: Esri.
National Park Service, undated, Unpublished polygon shapefile of 40 limestone glades at Stones River National Battlefield.

enttyp.enttypd: Tabular Information Associated with the Dataset

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.

attrdomv.udom: Coordinates defining the features.

attr.attrdef: Unique identifier according to glade numbering system internal to this study. Unique identifier according to glade numbering system internal to this study. Only 12 glades at Stones River National Battlefield were used for this study. These glades were numbered 1 through 12, starting in the Northeast quadrat and working clockwise.

attrdomv.udom: Unique identifier according to glade numbering system internal to this study. Unique identifier according to glade numbering system internal to this study. Only 12 glades at Stones River National Battlefield were used for this study. These glades were numbered 1 through 12, starting in the Northeast quadrat and working clockwise.

attr.attrdef: A value of 1 identifies a point as being located in a 3-meter buffer around the exterior of cedar glades. A value of 0 identifies a point as being within the interior of a cedar glade. Roughly 20 percent of points were assigned to a 3-meter buffer of forest (mostly J. virginiana) surrounding cedar glades. A value of 1 identifies a point as being located within this buffer zone outside of a cedar glade. A value of 0 identifies a point as being located within the interior of a cedar glade.

attrdomv.udom: A value of 1 identifies a point as being located in a 3-meter buffer around the exterior of cedar glades. A value of 0 identifies a point as being within the interior of a cedar glade. Roughly 20 percent of points were assigned to a 3-meter buffer of forest (mostly J. virginiana) surrounding cedar glades. A value of 1 identifies a point as being located within this buffer zone outside of a cedar glade. A value of 0 identifies a point as being located within the interior of a cedar glade

attr.attrdef: Positional Dilution of Precision reported by Global Positioning System (GPS) at the time measurements were made of depth to bedrock and ground-surface characterization. The Positional Dilution of Precision reported by the Global Positioning System (GPS) device (Trimble GeoXT handheld GPS running ArcPad software, Esri, Redlands, CA) at the time measurements were made of depth to bedrock and ground-surface characterizations. Values are determined by satellite configuration at the time measurements are made. Lower values indicate higher spatial precision.

attrdomv.udom: The Positional Dilution of Precision reported by the Global Positioning System (GPS) device (Trimble GeoXT handheld GPS running ArcPad software, Esri, Redlands, CA) at the time measurements were made of depth to bedrock and ground-surface characterizations. Values are determined by satellite configuration at the time measurements are made. Lower values indicate higher spatial precision.

attr.attrdef: The number of satellites available to the Global Positioning System (GPS) device at the time measurements were made of depth to bedrock and ground-surface characterization. The number of satellites available to the Global Positioning System (GPS) device (Trimble GeoXT handheld GPS running ArcPad software, Esri, Redlands, CA) at the time measurements were made of depth to bedrock and ground-surface characterization. A higher number of satellites is typically associated with a lower PDOP value and with greater spatial precision.

attrdomv.udom: The number of satellites available to the Global Positioning System (GPS) device at the time measurements were made of depth to bedrock and ground-surface characterization.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of visible fine gravel. Represents the percentage of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point covered by fine gravel, determined by visual inspection. Fine gravel is defined according to the Udden-Wentworth scale as ranging from 2 to 16 millimeters in diameter (Udden-Wentworth classes of “fine gravel” and “medium gravel”).“0” indicates no visible fine gravel, “1” indicates fine gravel covering less than 30 percent of the quadrat space, “2” indicates fine gravel covering from 30 percent to 70 percent of the quadrat space, and “3” indicates fine gravel covering more than 70 percent of the quadrat space.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of visible fine gravel. Represents the percentage of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point covered by fine gravel, determined by visual inspection. Fine gravel is defined according to the Udden-Wentworth scale as ranging from 2 to 16 millimeters in diameter (Udden-Wentworth classes of “fine gravel” and “medium gravel”).“0” indicates no visible fine gravel, “1” indicates fine gravel covering less than 30 percent of the quadrat space, “2” indicates fine gravel covering from 30 percent to 70 percent of the quadrat space, and “3” indicates fine gravel covering more than 70 percent of the quadrat space.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of visible coarse gravel. Represents the percentage of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point covered by coarse gravel, determined by visual inspection. Coarse gravel is defined according to the Udden-Wentworth scale as ranging from 16 to 64 millimeters in diameter (Udden-Wentworth classes of “coarse gravel” and “very coarse gravel”). “0” indicates no visible coarse gravel, “1” indicates coarse gravel covering less than 30 percent of the quadrat space, “2” indicates coarse gravel covering from 30 percent to 70 percent of the quadrat space, and “3” indicates coarse gravel covering more than 70 percent of the quadrat space.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of visible coarse gravel. Represents the percentage of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point covered by coarse gravel, determined by visual inspection. Coarse gravel is defined according to the Udden-Wentworth scale as ranging from 16 to 64 millimeters in diameter (Udden-Wentworth classes of “coarse gravel” and “very coarse gravel”). “0” indicates no visible coarse gravel, “1” indicates coarse gravel covering less than 30 percent of the quadrat space, “2” indicates coarse gravel covering from 30 percent to 70 percent of the quadrat space, and “3” indicates coarse gravel covering more than 70 percent of the quadrat space.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of visible cobbles. Represents the percentage of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point covered by cobbles, determined by visual inspection. A cobble is defined according to the Udden-Wentworth scale as ranging from 64 to 256 millimeters in diameter. “0” indicates no visible cobbles, “1” indicates cobbles covering less than 30 percent of the quadrat space, “2” indicates cobbles covering from 30 percent to 70 percent of the quadrat space, and “3” indicates cobbles covering more than 70 percent of the quadrat space.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of visible cobbles. Represents the percentage of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point covered by cobbles, determined by visual inspection. A cobble is defined according to the Udden-Wentworth scale as ranging from 64 to 256 millimeters in diameter. “0” indicates no visible cobbles, “1” indicates cobbles covering less than 30 percent of the quadrat space, “2” indicates cobbles covering from 30 percent to 70 percent of the quadrat space, and “3” indicates cobbles covering more than 70 percent of the quadrat space.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of visible flagstones. Represents the percentage of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point covered by flagstones, determined by visual inspection. A flagstone is defined as a pavement stone with a diameter greater than 256 millimeters in diameter (i.e. larger than a “cobble” based on the Udden-Wentworth scale). “0” indicates no visible flagstones, “1” indicates flagstones covering less than 30 percent of the quadrat space, “2” indicates flagstones covering from 30 percent to 70 percent of the quadrat space, and “3” indicates flagstones covering more than 70 percent of the quadrat space.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of visible flagstones. Represents the percentage of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point covered by flagstones, determined by visual inspection. A flagstone is defined as a pavement stone with a diameter greater than 256 millimeters in diameter (i.e. larger than a “cobble” based on the Udden-Wentworth scale). “0” indicates no visible flagstones, “1” indicates flagstones covering less than 30 percent of the quadrat space, “2” indicates flagstones covering from 30 percent to 70 percent of the quadrat space, and “3” indicates flagstones covering more than 70 percent of the quadrat space.

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether any pavement was visible on the ground surface. Coded as “1” if pavement (fine gravel, coarse gravel, cobbles or flagstones) is visible on the ground surface. Coded as “0” if pavement is not visible on the ground surface. Points without visible pavement (coded “0”) may still have had pavement above the soil surface, but pavement stones may have been covered by thick moss and/or vascular plants.

attrdomv.udom: Indicates whether any pavement was visible on the ground surface. Coded as “1” if pavement (fine gravel, coarse gravel, cobbles or flagstones) is visible on the ground surface. Coded as “0” if pavement is not visible on the ground surface. Points without visible pavement (coded “0”) may still have had pavement above the soil surface, but pavement stones may have been covered by thick moss and/or vascular plants.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of visible exposed bedrock. Represents the percentage of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point covered by exposed bedrock, determined by visual inspection. “0” indicates no exposed bedrock, “1” indicates exposed bedrock covering less than 30 percent of the quadrat space, “2” indicates exposed bedrock covering from 30 percent to 70 percent of the quadrat space, and “3” indicates exposed bedrock covering more than 70 percent of the quadrat space.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of visible exposed bedrock. Represents the percentage of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point covered by exposed bedrock, determined by visual inspection. “0” indicates no exposed bedrock, “1” indicates exposed bedrock covering less than 30 percent of the quadrat space, “2” indicates exposed bedrock covering from 30 percent to 70 percent of the quadrat space, and “3” indicates exposed bedrock covering more than 70 percent of the quadrat space.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of visible bare soil. Represents the percentage of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point of bare soil (i.e soil not covered by pavement, moss, plants, or other organisms), determined by visual inspection. “0” indicates no bare soil, “1” indicates bare soil covering less than 30 percent of the quadrat space, “2” indicates bare soil covering from 30 percent to 70 percent of the quadrat space, and “3” indicates bare soil covering more than 70 percent of the quadrat space.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of visible bare soil. Represents the percentage of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point of bare soil (i.e soil not covered by pavement, moss, plants, or other organisms), determined by visual inspection. “0” indicates no bare soil, “1” indicates bare soil covering less than 30 percent of the quadrat space, “2” indicates bare soil covering from 30 percent to 70 percent of the quadrat space, and “3” indicates bare soil covering more than 70 percent of the quadrat space.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of graminoids. Represents the existence of graminoid species of vascular plants (grasses) within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no graminoids, “1” indicates sparse graminoids, “2” represents moderate graminoids, and “3” indicates thick graminoids.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of graminoids. Represents the existence of graminoid species of vascular plants (grasses) within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no graminoids, “1” indicates sparse graminoids, “2” represents moderate graminoids, and “3” indicates thick graminoids.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of forbs. Represents the existence of herbaceous (non-woody) vascular plants which are not graminoids (grasses) within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no forbs, “1” indicates sparse forbs, “2” represents moderate forbs, and “3” indicates thick forbs.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of forbs. Represents the existence of herbaceous (non-woody) vascular plants which are not graminoids (grasses) within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no forbs, “1” indicates sparse forbs, “2” represents moderate forbs, and “3” indicates thick forbs.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of vines. Represents the existence of vines within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no vines, “1” indicates sparse vines, “2” represents moderate vines, and “3” indicates thick vines.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of vines. Represents the existence of vines within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no vines, “1” indicates sparse vines, “2” represents moderate vines, and “3” indicates thick vines.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of shrubs. Represents the existence of shrubs within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no shrubs, “1” indicates sparse shrubs, “2” represents moderate shrubs, and “3” indicates thick shrubs.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of shrubs. Represents the existence of shrubs within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no shrubs, “1” indicates sparse shrubs, “2” represents moderate shrubs, and “3” indicates thick shrubs.

attr.attrdef: Indicates the presence and height of J. virginiana trees within 1 meter of quadrat. Represents the existence of J. virginiana trees within a 1 meter radius of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no J. virginiana trees within 1 meter of the quadrat, “1” indicates J. virginiana saplings (trees less than 1 meter in height) within 1 meter of the quadrat, “2” indicates J. virginiana trees between 1 and 3 meters in height within 1 meter of the quadrat, and “3” indicates J. virginiana trees more than 3 meters in height within 1 meter of the quadrat. If J. virginiana trees of varying heights were present within 1 meter of the quadrat, the tallest trees were used for classification.

attrdomv.udom: Indicates the presence and height of J. virginiana trees within 1 meter of quadrat. Represents the existence of J. virginiana trees within a 1 meter radius of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no J. virginiana trees within 1 meter of the quadrat, “1” indicates J. virginiana saplings (trees less than 1 meter in height) within 1 meter of the quadrat, “2” indicates J. virginiana trees between 1 and 3 meters in height within 1 meter of the quadrat, and “3” indicates J. virginiana trees more than 3 meters in height within 1 meter of the quadrat. If J. virginiana trees of varying heights were present within 1 meter of the quadrat, the tallest trees were used for classification.

attr.attrdef: A count of the number of J. virginiana trees within a 1-meter radius of the quadrat. The number of J. virginiana trees within a 1-meter radius of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection.

attrdomv.udom: A count of the number of J. virginiana trees within a 1-meter radius of the quadrat. The number of J. virginiana trees within a 1-meter radius of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection.

attr.attrdef: Indicates the presence and height of trees other than J. virginiana within 1 meter of the quadrat. Represents the existence of any tree other than J. virginiana within a 1-meter radius of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no such trees within 1 meter of the quadrat, “1” indicates such trees less than 1 meter in height within 1 meter of the quadrat, “2” indicates such trees between 1 and 3 meters in height within 1 meter of the quadrat, and “3” indicates such trees more than 3 meters in height within 1 meter of the quadrat. If such trees of varying heights were present within 1 meter of the quadrat, the tallest trees were used for classification.

attrdomv.udom: Indicates the presence and height of trees other than J. virginiana within 1 meter of the quadrat. Represents the existence of any tree other than J. virginiana within a 1-meter radius of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no such trees within 1 meter of the quadrat, “1” indicates such trees less than 1 meter in height within 1 meter of the quadrat, “2” indicates such trees between 1 and 3 meters in height within 1 meter of the quadrat, and “3” indicates such trees more than 3 meters in height within 1 meter of the quadrat. If such trees of varying heights were present within 1 meter of the quadrat, the tallest trees were used for classification.

attr.attrdef: A count of the number of trees other than J. virginiana within a 1-meter radius of the quadrat. The number number of trees other than J. virginiana within a 1-meter radius of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection.

attrdomv.udom: A count of the number of trees other than J. virginiana within a 1-meter radius of the quadrat. The number number of trees other than J. virginiana within a 1-meter radius of a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of moss. Represents the existence of bryophytes within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. "0” indicates no bryophytes, “1” indicates sparse bryophytes, “2” represents moderate bryophytes, and “3” indicates thick bryophytes.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of moss. Represents the existence of bryophytes within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. "0” indicates no bryophytes, “1” indicates sparse bryophytes, “2” represents moderate bryophytes, and “3” indicates thick bryophytes.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of Nostoc commune. Represents the existence of N. commune within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. 0” indicates no N. commune, “1” indicates sparse N. commune, “2” represents moderate N. commune, and “3” indicates thick N. commune.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of Nostoc commune. Represents the existence of N. commune within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. 0” indicates no N. commune, “1” indicates sparse N. commune, “2” represents moderate N. commune, and “3” indicates thick N. commune.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of lichen. Represents the existence of lichens within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. This category includes so-called “reindeer moss” but does not include the colored surfaces of pavement stones. 0” indicates no lichen, “1” indicates sparse lichen, “2” represents moderate lichen, and “3” indicates thick lichen.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of lichen. Represents the existence of lichens within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. This category includes so-called “reindeer moss” but does not include the colored surfaces of pavement stones. 0” indicates no lichen, “1” indicates sparse lichen, “2” represents moderate lichen, and “3” indicates thick lichen.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of biological soil crust. Represents the existence of biological soil crust within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. Within cedar glade ecosystems, biological soil crust is composed of a diverse community of organisms including lichen, bryophytes, and cyanobacteria. At the outer surface of the crust is a foliose lichen which is probably either Placidium lacinulatum or P. squamulosum. This community is not categorized as lichen or moss because it is a distinct association of organisms. “0” indicates no crust, “1” indicates sparse crust, “2” represents moderate crust, and “3” indicates thick crust.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of biological soil crust. Represents the existence of biological soil crust within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. Within cedar glade ecosystems, biological soil crust is composed of a diverse community of organisms including lichen, bryophytes, and cyanobacteria. At the outer surface of the crust is a foliose lichen which is probably either Placidium lacinulatum or P. squamulosum. This community is not categorized as lichen or moss because it is a distinct association of organisms. “0” indicates no crust, “1” indicates sparse crust, “2” represents moderate crust, and “3” indicates thick crust.

attr.attrdef: Score based on quadrat percentage of leaf litter. Represents the existence of leaf litter within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no leaf litter, “1” indicates sparse leaf litter, “2” represents moderate leaf litter, and “3” indicates thick leaf litter.

attrdomv.udom: Score based on quadrat percentage of leaf litter. Represents the existence of leaf litter within a 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point, based on visual inspection. “0” indicates no leaf litter, “1” indicates sparse leaf litter, “2” represents moderate leaf litter, and “3” indicates thick leaf litter.

attr.attrdef: Code representing the presence or absence of trash or debris. “1” indicates presence of trash or debris within the 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat, “0” indicates absence of trash or debris.

attrdomv.udom: Code representing the presence or absence of trash or debris. “1” indicates presence of trash or debris within the 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat, “0” indicates absence of trash or debris.

attr.attrdef: First measurement of depth to bedrock (soil depth) at a given point. Depth to bedrock (soil depth) in centimeters at the northwest corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. Depth to bedrock was measured four times at each point, using a 1-centimeter-diameter metal probe inserted as far down into the soil as possible, after temporarily removing any pavement on the soil surface.

attrdomv.udom: First measurement of depth to bedrock (soil depth) at a given point. Depth to bedrock (soil depth) in centimeters at the northwest corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. Depth to bedrock was measured four times at each point, using a 1-centimeter-diameter metal probe inserted as far down into the soil as possible, after temporarily removing any pavement on the soil surface.

attr.attrdef: Thickness of first pavement removed (if any) to measure depth to bedrock. The thickness in centimeters of any pavement removed in order to measure depth to bedrock at the northwest corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. A value of “0” indicates no pavement was removed in order to take the measurement.

attrdomv.udom: Thickness of first pavement removed (if any) to measure depth to bedrock. The thickness in centimeters of any pavement removed in order to measure depth to bedrock at the northwest corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. A value of “0” indicates no pavement was removed in order to take the measurement.

attr.attrdef: Second measurement of depth to bedrock (soil depth) at a given point. Depth to bedrock (soil depth) in centimeters at the northeast corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. Depth to bedrock was measured four times at each point, using a 1-centimeter-diameter metal probe inserted as far down into the soil as possible, after temporarily removing any pavement on the soil surface.

attrdomv.udom: Second measurement of depth to bedrock (soil depth) at a given point. Depth to bedrock (soil depth) in centimeters at the northeast corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. Depth to bedrock was measured four times at each point, using a 1-centimeter-diameter metal probe inserted as far down into the soil as possible, after temporarily removing any pavement on the soil surface.

attr.attrdef: Thickness of second pavement removed (if any) to measure depth to bedrock. The thickness in centimeters of any pavement removed in order to measure depth to bedrock at the northeast corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. A value of “0” indicates no pavement was removed in order to take the measurement.

attrdomv.udom: Thickness of second pavement removed (if any) to measure depth to bedrock. The thickness in centimeters of any pavement removed in order to measure depth to bedrock at the northeast corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. A value of “0” indicates no pavement was removed in order to take the measurement.

attr.attrdef: Third measurement of depth to bedrock (soil depth) at a given point. Depth to bedrock (soil depth) in centimeters at the southeast corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. Depth to bedrock was measured four times at each point, using a 1-centimeter-diameter metal probe inserted as far down into the soil as possible, after temporarily removing any pavement on the soil surface.

attrdomv.udom: Third measurement of depth to bedrock (soil depth) at a given point. Depth to bedrock (soil depth) in centimeters at the southeast corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. Depth to bedrock was measured four times at each point, using a 1-centimeter-diameter metal probe inserted as far down into the soil as possible, after temporarily removing any pavement on the soil surface.

attr.attrdef: Thickness of third pavement removed (if any) to measure depth to bedrock. The thickness in centimeters of any pavement removed in order to measure depth to bedrock at the southeast corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. A value of “0” indicates no pavement was removed in order to take the measurement.

attrdomv.udom: Thickness of third pavement removed (if any) to measure depth to bedrock. The thickness in centimeters of any pavement removed in order to measure depth to bedrock at the southeast corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. A value of “0” indicates no pavement was removed in order to take the measurement.

attr.attrdef: Fourth measurement of depth to bedrock (soil depth) at a given point. Depth to bedrock (soil depth) in centimeters at the southwest corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. Depth to bedrock was measured four times at each point, using a 1-centimeter-diameter metal probe inserted as far down into the soil as possible, after temporarily removing any pavement on the soil surface.

attrdomv.udom: Fourth measurement of depth to bedrock (soil depth) at a given point. Depth to bedrock (soil depth) in centimeters at the southwest corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. Depth to bedrock was measured four times at each point, using a 1-centimeter-diameter metal probe inserted as far down into the soil as possible, after temporarily removing any pavement on the soil surface.

attr.attrdef: Thickness of fourth pavement removed (if any) to measure depth to bedrock. The thickness in centimeters of any pavement removed in order to measure depth to bedrock at the southwest corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. A value of “0” indicates no pavement was removed in order to take the measurement.

attrdomv.udom: Thickness of fourth pavement removed (if any) to measure depth to bedrock. The thickness in centimeters of any pavement removed in order to measure depth to bedrock at the southwest corner of a north-oriented 50-centimeter by 50-centimeter quadrat laid on the ground at the point. A value of “0” indicates no pavement was removed in order to take the measurement.

attr.attrdef: Mean value of DTB_A, DTB_B, DTB_C and DTB_D. Mean value of four depth to bedrock measurements at each point: DTB_A, DTB_B, DTB_C and DTB_D. This mean value was used in subsequent analysis to represent depth to bedrock for a given point.

attrdomv.udom: Mean value of DTB_A, DTB_B, DTB_C and DTB_D. Mean value of four depth to bedrock measurements at each point: DTB_A, DTB_B, DTB_C and DTB_D. This mean value was used in subsequent analysis to represent depth to bedrock for a given point.

attr.attrdef: Distance from point to the nearest edge of a cedar glade, in meters. Distance from a given point to the nearest edge of the cedar glade within which it lies (if the field 3m_buf has a value of 0) or outside which it lies (if 3m_buf is 1). This value was calculated using line features to represent glade boundaries. Points within glade interiors (the field 3m_buf has a value of 0) have positive DGE values; points in a 3-meter buffer around the edge of cedar glades (3m_buf has a value of1) have negative DGE values.

attrdomv.udom: Distance from point to the nearest edge of a cedar glade, in meters. Distance from a given point to the nearest edge of the cedar glade within which it lies (if the field 3m_buf has a value of 0) or outside which it lies (if 3m_buf is 1). This value was calculated using line features to represent glade boundaries. Points within glade interiors (the field 3m_buf has a value of 0) have positive DGE values; points in a 3-meter buffer around the edge of cedar glades (3m_buf has a value of1) have negative DGE values.

attr.attrdef: Percent canopy coverage in the central quadrat, values range from 0 to 100. Null values are coded as -99999. Percent canopy coverage for the central quadrat, based on quantitative analysis of digital photographs taken with a level, north-oriented camera positioned approximately 20 centimeters above the ground surface. Values ranging from 0 to 100 represent the percentage of the central quadrat covered by canopy. A value of zero would indicate no canopy (only sky visible in that quadrat of the photograph) and a value of 100 would represent no sky visible, only canopy. Null values are coded as -99999.

attrdomv.udom: Percent canopy coverage in the central quadrat, values range from 0 to 100. Null values are coded as -99999. Percent canopy coverage for the central quadrat, based on quantitative analysis of digital photographs taken with a level, north-oriented camera positioned approximately 20 centimeters above the ground surface. Values ranging from 0 to 100 represent the percentage of the central quadrat covered by canopy. A value of zero would indicate no canopy (only sky visible in that quadrat of the photograph) and a value of 100 would represent no sky visible, only canopy. Null values are coded as -99999.

attr.attrdef: Percent canopy coverage in the eastern quadrat, values range from 0 to 100. Null values are coded as -99999. Percent canopy coverage for the eastern quadrat, based on quantitative analysis of digital photographs taken with a level, north-oriented camera positioned approximately 20 centimeters above the ground surface. Values ranging from 0 to 100 represent the percentage of the eastern quadrat covered by canopy. A value of zero would indicate no canopy (only sky visible in that quadrat of the photograph) and a value of 100 would represent no sky visible, only canopy. Null values are coded as -99999.

attrdomv.udom: Percent canopy coverage in the eastern quadrat, values range from 0 to 100. Null values are coded as -99999. Percent canopy coverage for the eastern quadrat, based on quantitative analysis of digital photographs taken with a level, north-oriented camera positioned approximately 20 centimeters above the ground surface. Values ranging from 0 to 100 represent the percentage of the eastern quadrat covered by canopy. A value of zero would indicate no canopy (only sky visible in that quadrat of the photograph) and a value of 100 would represent no sky visible, only canopy. Null values are coded as -99999.

attr.attrdef: Percent canopy coverage in the northern quadrat, values range from 0 to 100. Null values are coded as -99999. Percent canopy coverage for the northern quadrat, based on quantitative analysis of digital photographs taken with a level, north-oriented camera positioned approximately 20 centimeters above the ground surface. Values ranging from 0 to 100 represent the percentage of the northern quadrat covered by canopy. A value of zero would indicate no canopy (only sky visible in that quadrat of the photograph) and a value of 100 would represent no sky visible, only canopy. Null values are coded as -99999.

attrdomv.udom: Percent canopy coverage in the northern quadrat, values range from 0 to 100. Null values are coded as -99999. Percent canopy coverage for the northern quadrat, based on quantitative analysis of digital photographs taken with a level, north-oriented camera positioned approximately 20 centimeters above the ground surface. Values ranging from 0 to 100 represent the percentage of the northern quadrat covered by canopy. A value of zero would indicate no canopy (only sky visible in that quadrat of the photograph) and a value of 100 would represent no sky visible, only canopy. Null values are coded as -99999.

attr.attrdef: Percent canopy coverage in the southern quadrat, values range from 0 to 100. Null values are coded as -99999. Percent canopy coverage for the southern quadrat, based on quantitative analysis of digital photographs taken with a level, north-oriented camera positioned approximately 20 centimeters above the ground surface. Values ranging from 0 to 100 represent the percentage of the southern quadrat covered by canopy. A value of zero would indicate no canopy (only sky visible in that quadrat of the photograph) and a value of 100 would represent no sky visible, only canopy. Null values are coded as -99999.

attrdomv.udom: Percent canopy coverage in the southern quadrat, values range from 0 to 100. Null values are coded as -99999. Percent canopy coverage for the southern quadrat, based on quantitative analysis of digital photographs taken with a level, north-oriented camera positioned approximately 20 centimeters above the ground surface. Values ranging from 0 to 100 represent the percentage of the southern quadrat covered by canopy. A value of zero would indicate no canopy (only sky visible in that quadrat of the photograph) and a value of 100 would represent no sky visible, only canopy. Null values are coded as -99999.

attr.attrdef: Percent canopy coverage in the western quadrat, values range from 0 to 100. Null values are coded as -99999. Percent canopy coverage for the western quadrat, based on quantitative analysis of digital photographs taken with a level, north-oriented camera positioned approximately 20 centimeters above the ground surface. Values ranging from 0 to 100 represent the percentage of the western quadrat covered by canopy. A value of zero would indicate no canopy (only sky visible in that quadrat of the photograph) and a value of 100 would represent no sky visible, only canopy. Null values are coded as -99999.

attrdomv.udom: Percent canopy coverage in the western quadrat, values range from 0 to 100. Null values are coded as -99999. Percent canopy coverage for the western quadrat, based on quantitative analysis of digital photographs taken with a level, north-oriented camera positioned approximately 20 centimeters above the ground surface. Values ranging from 0 to 100 represent the percentage of the western quadrat covered by canopy. A value of zero would indicate no canopy (only sky visible in that quadrat of the photograph) and a value of 100 would represent no sky visible, only canopy. Null values are coded as -99999.

attr.attrdef: A 3 or 4 digit code serving as a unique identifier for all points in this study.

attrdomv.udom: A 3 or 4 digit code serving as a unique identifier for all points in this study.

attr.attrdef: Unique glade identification number according to Cofer et al (2008). These glade codes represent the unique glade identification numbers assigned previously by the National Park Service to delineated cedar glades at Stones River National Battlefiled. The glade codes in this field correspond to those which label a map of all delineated cedar glades at this site, which is presented in Figure 1 of Cofer et al (2008). Reference: Cofer, M., Walck, J., and Hidayati, S. (2008). Species richness and exotic species invasion in Middle Tennessee cedar glades in relation to abiotic and biotic factors. The Journal of the Torrey Botanical Society, 135(4), 540–553.
attr.attrdefs: Unique glade identification number according to Cofer et al (2008)

attrdomv.udom: These glade codes represent the unique glade identification numbers assigned previously by the National Park Service to delineated cedar glades at Stones River National Battlefiled. The glade codes in this field correspond to those which label a map of all delineated cedar glades at this site, as presented in Figure 1 of Cofer et al (2008). Reference: Cofer, M., Walck, J., and Hidayati, S. (2008). Species richness and exotic species invasion in Middle Tennessee cedar glades in relation to abiotic and biotic factors. The Journal of the Torrey Botanical Society, 135(4), 540–553.
